intro: Caladenia fuliginosa, commonly known as the black-lip spider-orchid, is an endemic species of the Australian flora. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant typically grows in heathland and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually greenish-brown with a distinctive red or purple lip, and it blooms during the cooler months. Caladenia fuliginosa is a terrestrial herb with a short, erect stem and linear leaves.
